publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-525 Trish Godman: West of Scotland Water Authority—That the Parliament deplores the high-handed and insensitive conduct of senior officials at West of Scotland Water Authority in relation to the unsupportable decision to allow raw sewage and waste water to enter the Kilbarchan Burn; affirms the view that such authorities must always be cognisant of local community concerns when taking decisions that impinge upon local communities; and that genuine consultation and concern for public health must always be the order the day when making such decisions. Supported by: Hugh Henry*
